src.game
Class EnemyMovement

java.lang.Object
  src.game.EnemyMovement

public class EnemyMovement
extends java.lang.Object

This class will perform movement on specified enemies.

Author:
Darren Watts date 11/11/07

Method Detail

chanceToSpawnEnemy

public static void chanceToSpawnEnemy(int plrRow,
                                      int plrCol,
                                      int plrLevel,
                                      boolean inDungeon)
If the random number decides to spawn an enemy, it will find a spot around the given row and column to create a new enemy.

Parameters:
plrRow - int : player's row
plrCol - int : player's column
plrLevel - int: player's level

spawnShopkeeper

public static void spawnShopkeeper(int row,
                                   int col,
                                   Player plr)
Spawns a shopkeeper near the shop at the specified location.

Parameters:
row - int : row of shop
col - int : column of shop
plr - Player : the player near the shop

spawnIfPossible

private static boolean spawnIfPossible(int row,
                                       int col)
Checks to see if the specified location in the world can hold a new shopkeeper. If it can, create a new shopkeeper at that location and return true. Otherwise, return false.

Parameters:
row - int : row to try to spawn shopkeeper
col - int : column to try to spawn shopkeeper
Returns:
boolean : whether or not spawning was a success

getRandomSpawnedEnemy

private static Enemies getRandomSpawnedEnemy(boolean inDungeon)
                                      throws EnemySpawnNotDefinedException
Gets a random type of enemy that can be spawned at the current level.

Returns:
Enemies : enemy type that will spawn
Throws:
EnemySpawnNotDefinedException

enemyInAttackingRange

private static boolean enemyInAttackingRange(Enemy enemy,
                                             Player plr)
Checks to see if the enemy is in attacking range of the player. In a dungeon, the enemy cannot attack diagonally, but outside the enemy can.

Parameters:
enemy - Enemy : the attacking enemy
plr - Player : the player being attacked
Returns:
boolean : in range

activate

public static void activate(Enemy enemy)
Will activate the specified enemy.

Parameters:
enemy - The enemy to activate.

determineRunningDirection

public static Direction determineRunningDirection(int runnerRow,
                                                  int runnerCol,
                                                  int chaserRow,
                                                  int chaserCol)
Calculates the direction the enemy should move.

Parameters:
runnerRow - int : row of the target enemy/player
runnerCol - int : column of the target enemy/player
chaserRow - int : row of the player/enemy chasing target
chaserCol - int : column of the player.enemy chasing target
Returns:
Direction : direction the enemy should move

shoot

private static void shoot(Enemy enemy,
                          Direction direction)
Enemy has a 50% chance of shooting a rocket in the specified direction.

Parameters:
enemy - Enemy : the enemy that is shooting
direction - Direction : direction

move

public static void move(Enemy enemy,
                        Direction direction)
Will attempt to move the enemy in the specified direction. If the enemy cannot move in the desired direction, he will continue to try other directions until he find one that succeeds, or he runs out of options.

Parameters:
enemy - Enemy : enemy that is moving
direction - Direction : desired direction

moveDungeon

public static void moveDungeon(Enemy enemy,
                               Direction direction)
Will attempt to move the enemy in the specified direction. If the enemy cannot move in the desired direction, he will continue to try other directions until he find one that succeeds, or he runs out of options. In a dungeon, the enemy cannot move diagonally.

Parameters:
enemy - Enemy : enemy that is moving
direction - Direction : desired direction

tryMove

private static boolean tryMove(Enemy enemy,
                               Direction direction)
Attempts to move the enemy in the specified direction. Returns whether or not the move was successful.

Parameters:
enemy - The enemy moving
direction - Direction : the direction to move
Returns:
boolean : success
